question: <image 1><image 2>
description:
The image consists of two parts:

**Part 1:**  
It shows a musical bar in compound time with the time signature 9/8. The key signature has four sharps (F#, C#, G#, D#). The notes in the bar are as follows:  
- A dotted quarter note (three eighth notes) followed by an eighth note rest.  
- Two eighth notes tied together, followed by another eighth note.  
- A quarter note.  

**Part 2:**  
This part presents three options for rewriting the bar from Part 1 in simple time. Each option includes a different time signature and arrangement of notes. The options are labeled with boxes to tick the correct one.  

**Option 1:**  
- Time signature: 4/4  
- Notes: A dotted quarter note followed by an eighth note rest.  
- Two eighth notes tied together, followed by another eighth note.  
- A quarter note.  

**Option 2:**  
- Time signature: 3/4  
- Notes: An eighth note followed by an eighth note rest.  
- Two eighth notes tied together, followed by another eighth note.  
- A quarter note.  

**Option 3:**  
- Time signature: 3/4  
- Notes: A dotted quarter note followed by an eighth note rest.  
- Two eighth notes tied together, followed by another eighth note.  
- A quarter note.  

The task is to determine which of these options correctly rewrites the bar from Part 1 in simple time.
